title.text: THE BEST IN LINGUISTICS FROM CAMBRIDGE Partiality, Modality, and Nonmonotonicity

abstractContent.text: This edited volume of articles provides a state-of the art description of research in logic-based approaches to knowledge representation, which combines approaches to reasoning with incomplete information that include partial, modal, and nonmonotonic logics.

Studies in Logic, Language and Information 1-57586-030-9 Paperback $22.95 Ambiguity Resolution in Language Learning Computational and Cognitive Models Hinrich SchOtze This volume is concerned with how ambiguity and ambiguity resolution are learned, that is, with the acquisition of the different representations of ambiguous linguistic forms and the knowledge necessary for selecting among them in context.
